meanings.definition: The act of guiding and tending a flock of sheep.
meanings.sent1: Sheepherding requires patience and skill to keep the flock safe.
meanings.sent2: In the countryside, you can often see sheepherding taking place on vast fields.
meanings.sent3: The sheepherding competition at the fair was intense but also quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the hills were alive with the peaceful sound of sheepherding.
meanings.sent5: The young shepherd learned the art of sheepherding from his grandfather.

meanings.definition: The practice of managing and caring for sheep.
meanings.sent1: Proper sheepherding involves ensuring the sheep are well-fed and healthy.
meanings.sent2: Sheepherding is a vital part of agriculture in many rural communities.
meanings.sent3: The sheepherding manual had detailed instructions on sheep grooming.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to sheepherding was evident in the well-maintained pastures.
meanings.sent5: The shepherd's love for sheepherding was evident in the way he spoke about his flock.

meanings.sent1: Sheepherding is a demanding job that requires early mornings and late nights.
meanings.sent2: The family has been in the sheepherding business for generations.
meanings.sent3: The sheepherding union negotiated for better working conditions for its members.
meanings.sent4: The shepherd's hat was a symbol of his dedication to sheepherding.
meanings.sent5: The sheepherding community came together to celebrate a successful lambing season.
